head.title: Schooner Nancy, Log and Lists of Provisions, 1811-1813. - Page #3

body.p: << First Page | < Previous Page | Page #3 of 71 | Next Page > | Last Page >>

td.p: Mackintosh, Alexander. Schooner Nancy, Log and Lists of Provisions, 1811-1813. An electronic transcription. MFTP #0039

div.p: Remarks on board the Schooner Nancy, Transport at anchor in the river Miamia in the month of July 1813.

First part of this day very warm & clear weather, at about 1 PM Mayor Chambers of the 41st & Doctor Ogilvie passed by from Amherstburg for Headquarte[rs] latter part, at day light out Troops crossed the river & took up a position opposite the Old Fort Miamia & about 2 miles below Fort Meigs – latter part of the day light airs at SW[.]

Fore part of this day sent the men for wood, I go up to Headquarters, & from there within gun shot of the American fort, several boats passed by, some from Amherstburg & one from River Raisin, – nothing of importance is done by our troops this day, but a surmise of an intended expedition being sent to lower Sandusky, in the afternoon I return on board, Recd a six pounder limber on board & sent some ball cartridge up with some flints, light airs of winds at South & very warm – heard of the Mary['s] arrival at Malden[.]

Fore part of this day very warm, light breezes of wind at SW & clear weather, unmoored, the hauser broke in several places, spliced it again, men employed making wads for the guns, (yesterday our cooking pan was found on board the Ellen – latter part heavy thunder, sharplightening, & heavy showers of rain, winds variable from the Westwards[,] moored again with the kedge athwart the River – a sharp firing is distinclly heard in the direction of the American Fort – since heard of its being a skirmish between the Indians & america[ns] a mail was taken by the Indians from some americans, the effected their escape by throwing the mail away & running to the Fort – at about 9 PM a boat passed downwards, the men singing english, – at a loss to know who they are, send up to The commissary to enquire who says it is a boat coming dow[n] for provisions, – at about 12 oclock they return again upw[ard] having over shot the vessels, & in form us of 3 Boats being at Swan creek, on her going down, she was several times hailed but no answer was

in red , modifications made by the editor(s).
in lavender , modifications made by the assumed author(s).
